name: Gunmetal
tagline: it's probably the best thing ever
body:
### di for people who don't hate themselves
Spring has taken approximately 8 months of my life by forcing me to help coworkers debug the proxy magic and XML spaghetti.  Dagger takes too long to compile and is too rigid in the wrong ways for the server side.  Guice has become a bloated, visionless mess.  Gunmetal has none of these problems! (instead it probably has many other issues that could be harped on...)

Gunmetal is built around the principles of traceability, visibility, type-safety, fast build-deploy, a full set of the most killer DI features, and eschewing non-killer DI features.

```
$ cd ../need/code/examples/here
```

Here's where I pretend to cover everything in a clear and concise manner:

### Basic usage
happy module API time (jsr330ish)

### Qualifiers and overrides
one type+qualifier unless override enabled 

### Auto Collections
what sat?

### Stateless and Stateful Modules
which when?  

### Visibility
private, public, white list, black list, dependsOn, qualifiers

### Scope
prototype, singleton, custom, plus/child

### Eager vs Lazy
prototype, singleton

### What got left out?
assisted inject (needless traceability killer, just use providers and lambdas)
aspects (generally a traceability killer, may add in future)
visitor/post-processor - coming just not yet implemented

### Authors and Contributors
@rsby
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
